sen.j: 伊勢（いせ）氏は、日本の氏族。
sen.e: The Ise clan is a Japanese clan.
The Ise clan is a Japanese clan.
The Ise clan is a Japanese clan.

sen.j: いくつかの流れがある。
sen.e: There were flows in the following way.
There were several lines as follows:
There were several lines as follows:

sen.j: 桓武平氏の一族。
sen.e: The Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) family
The Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) family
The Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) family

sen.j: 本項で詳述。
sen.e: This is explained in detail in this clause.
This is explained in detail in this article.
This is explained in detail in this article.

sen.j: 武蔵七党の一派児玉党の一族。
sen.e: The Ise clan flowed from a group in the Musashi-shichito Parties, the Kodama Party family.
The clan of Kodama Party, one of the Musashi-shichito Parties (seven parties of samurai in Musashi Province)
The clan of Kodama Party, one of the Musashi-shichito Parties (seven parties of samurai in Musashi Province)

sen.j: 氏古代氏族としての氏としては有道氏。
sen.e: This ancient clan descended from the Arimichi clan.
sen.cmt: 「氏古代氏族」は「古代氏族」の誤りと思われます。
sen.e: This clan descended from the ancient Arimichi clan.
This clan descended from the ancient Arimichi clan.

sen.j: 桓武平氏流伊勢氏は、平維衡の後裔と言われる名門である。
sen.e: The Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) lineage of the Ise clan is thought to have descended from the TAIRA-no-Korehira family pedigree.
The Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) lineage of the Ise clan is thought to have descended from the TAIRA-no-Korehira family pedigree.
The Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) lineage of the Ise clan is thought to have descended from the TAIRA-no-Korehira family pedigree.

sen.j: 伊勢氏は武家の礼儀作法を司り、代々室町幕府の足利将軍家の嫡男に作法等を教えていた。
sen.e: The Ise clan took charge for civility and rules of etiquette, there for the clan taught the art of manners to the legitimate sons of the Ashikaga Shogunal family; this was implemented during the Muromachi bakufu period for generation after generation.

The Ise clan took charge of civility and rules of etiquette of samurai families, and the clan taught the art of manners to the legitimate sons of the Ashikaga Shogunal family for generation after generation during the Muromachi bakufu period.

The Ise clan took charge of civility and rules of etiquette of samurai families, and the clan taught the art of manners to the legitimate sons of the Ashikaga Shogunal family for generation after generation during the Muromachi bakufu period.

sen.j: 足利氏との関係は南北朝時代 (日本)の伊勢貞継まで遡る。
sen.e: Relations with the Ashikaga clan could date back to the Sadatsugu ISE period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Relations with the Ashikaga clan dates back to the Sadatsugu ISE in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Relations with the Ashikaga clan dates back to the Sadatsugu ISE in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 伊勢貞親は8代将軍足利義政の教育係を務め、政治にも大きな影響力を持った。
sen.e: Sadachika ISE served as a tutor to the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, which resulted in a significant influence over politics as well.
Sadachika ISE served as a tutor to the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, which resulted in a significant influence over politics as well.
Sadachika ISE served as a tutor to the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, which resulted in a significant influence over politics as well.

sen.j: 貞親の子の伊勢貞宗、孫の伊勢貞陸は台頭する細川氏の細川政元と協調し引き続き幕政に重きをなした。
sen.e: Sadamune ISE was a child of Sadachika and Sadamichi ISE a grandson of Sadachika, whom cooperated with Masamoto HOSOKAWA; he was from the rising Hosokawa clan and continued in the influential position of the bakufu..

Sadamune ISE, a child of Sadachika, and Sadamichi ISE, a grandson of Sadachika, cooperated with Masamoto HOSOKAWA who was from the rising Hosokawa clan and continued to have the influential position in the bakufu..

Sadamune ISE, a child of Sadachika, and Sadamichi ISE, a grandson of Sadachika, cooperated with Masamoto HOSOKAWA who was from the rising Hosokawa clan and continued to have the influential position in the bakufu..

sen.j: 貞陸の孫の伊勢貞孝とその子伊勢貞良は、12代将軍足利義晴、13代将軍足利義輝に仕えた。
sen.e: A grandchild of Sadamichi, Sadataka ISE and his son, Sadayoshi ISE, served the 12th Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and the 13th Shogun Yoshiteru.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A grandchild of Sadamichi, Sadataka ISE and his son, Sadayoshi ISE, served the 12th Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and the 13th Shogun Yoshiteru.
A grandchild of Sadamichi, Sadataka ISE and his son, Sadayoshi ISE, served the 12th Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and the 13th Shogun Yoshiteru.

sen.j: 義輝の代に、細川氏の没落後台頭した三好長慶と共に幕政を壟断したものの長慶と対立し失脚したため勢力を弱めた。
sen.e: Since Nagayoshi MIYOSHI increased in power after the decline of the Hosokawa clan, this resulted in the exclusive possession of the shogunate government by the Ise clan and Nagayoshi MIYOSHI during Shogun Yoshiteru's period, but later the Ise clan conflicted with Nagayoshi and lost their position and weakening their power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the period of Yoshiteru, they exclusively controlled the shogunate government with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who increased in power after the decline of the Hosokawa clan, but later the Ise clan conflicted with Nagayoshi and lost their position, weakening their power.

During the period of Yoshiteru, they exclusively controlled the shogunate government with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who increased in power after the decline of the Hosokawa clan, but later the Ise clan conflicted with Nagayoshi and lost their position, weakening their power.

sen.j: しかし足利義昭が織田信長とともに上洛してくると、貞良の子である貞為と貞興は幕府に仕える。
sen.e: However, when Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA and Nobunaga ODA went to Kyoto together, Sadayoshi's children, Sadatame and Sadaoki served as bailiffs.
However, when Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA and Nobunaga ODA went to Kyoto together, Sadayoshi's children, Sadatame and Sadaoki served as bailiffs.
However, when Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA and Nobunaga ODA went to Kyoto together, Sadayoshi's children, Sadatame and Sadaoki served as bailiffs.

sen.j: 貞為は病弱であったため家督を貞興に譲った。
sen.e: Due to Sadatames' illness, he transferred the headship of the family to Sadaoki.
Due to Sadatames' illness, he transferred the headship of the family to Sadaoki.
Due to Sadatames' illness, he transferred the headship of the family to Sadaoki.

sen.j: 貞興は義昭の備後下向には従わず、以後明智光秀の与力となる。
sen.e: Sadaoki didn't go to Binog with Yoshiaki instead he became a yoriki (a police sergeant) for Mitsuhide AKECHI.
Sadaoki didn't go to Bingo with Yoshiaki, but he became a yoriki (a police sergeant) for Mitsuhide AKECHI.
Sadaoki didn't go to Bingo with Yoshiaki, but he became a yoriki (a police sergeant) for Mitsuhide AKECHI.

sen.j: 本能寺の変の後の山崎の戦いにおいて伊勢貞興は明智勢として二条御所の織田信忠を攻め滅ぼしたが、最終的には羽柴勢に敗れた。
sen.e: After the Honnoji Incident, Sadaoki ISE participated in the Battle of Yamazaki as an Akechi force, and Sadaoki ISE attacked and conquered Nobutada ODA at Nijo-gosho Palace. Later, finally Sadaoki was lost by Hashiba force.

After the Honnoji Incident, Sadaoki ISE participated in the Battle of Yamazaki as an Akechi force, and Sadaoki ISE attacked and conquered Nobutada ODA at Nijo-gosho Palace, but later, Sadaoki was eventually lost to the Hashiba force.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを取って一文にしました。
sen.e: After the Honnoji Incident, Sadaoki ISE participated in the Battle of Yamazaki as an Akechi force, and Sadaoki ISE attacked and conquered Nobutada ODA at Nijo-gosho Palace, but later, Sadaoki was eventually lost to the Hashiba force.

sen.j: 貞興の兄の子の伊勢貞衡が江戸時代に徳川氏に仕え、その子孫は大身の旗本として続いた。
sen.e: A child of Sadaoki, Sadahira ISE served the Tokugawa clan during Edo period, their offspring continued to serve as a taishin hatamoto (greater vassal and a direct retainer of the Shogun) family.

A child of Sadaoki, Sadahira ISE served the Tokugawa clan during the Edo period, and their offspring continued to serve as a taishin hatamoto (greater vassal and a direct retainer of the Shogun) family.

A child of Sadaoki, Sadahira ISE served the Tokugawa clan during the Edo period, and their offspring continued to serve as a taishin hatamoto (greater vassal and a direct retainer of the Shogun) family.

sen.j: 戦国大名後北条氏の祖となる北条早雲こと伊勢宗瑞は伊勢氏の一族である。
sen.e: Normally known as Soun HOJO, Sozui ISE of the Ise clan, was the founder of Gohojo clan, and the Gohojo clan became daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The founder of Gohojo clan, a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period, Sozui ISE (normally known as Soun HOJO), belonged to the Ise clan.
The founder of Gohojo clan, a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period, Sozui ISE (normally known as Soun HOJO), belonged to the Ise clan.

sen.j: 系図は諸説あるが庶流である備中伊勢氏の出自であると目されている。
sen.e: Although there were several theories as to their roots, scholars believed the branch originated with Ise clan of Bitchu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although there were several theories as to his roots, scholars believe he was from a branch family Ise clan of Bitchu.
sen.cmt: 伊勢宗瑞のことなので"theいｒ "ではなく"his"で受けました。
sen.e: Although there were several theories as to his roots, scholars believe he was from a branch family Ise clan of Bitchu.

sen.j: なお早雲の一族が「北条」と名乗るのは、早雲の死後の息子北条氏綱の時代以後とされている。
sen.e: In addition, after Soun's death, his son, Ujitsuna HOJO became a successor; since then, the Soun families began to refer to themselves as "Hojo."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that the family of Soun started to call themselves 'Hojo' after Soun's death, in the period of his son Ujitsuna HOJO.
It is said that the family of Soun started to call themselves 'Hojo' after Soun's death, in the period of his son Ujitsuna HOJO.

sen.j: 厳密に言えば早雲時代の北条家は「伊勢家」と称するのが正しいと言える。
sen.e: Therefore, strictly speaking, it would be correct to call the days of Soun's Hojo family as an "Ise family."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, strictly speaking, it would be correct to call the Hojo family in the days of Soun's 'Ise family.'
Therefore, strictly speaking, it would be correct to call the Hojo family in the days of Soun's 'Ise family.'
